examples.text: Technology is not a <w>panacea</w> for all our educational challenges.
The new policy was presented as a <w>panacea</w> for the economic crisis.

senses.sense_definition: A remedy believed to cure all disease and prolong life; a cure-all.

examples.text: Medieval alchemists spent their lives searching for a <w>panacea</w> to heal every sickness.
The traveling salesman claimed his tonic was a <w>panacea</w> for everything from headaches to fevers.

traits.comment: referring to the literal alchemical concept

senses.sense_definition: The plant allheal (Valeriana officinalis), believed to cure all ills.

examples.text: The herbalist identified the <w>panacea</w> growing wild near the riverbank.
Ancient texts describe how to prepare a salve from the roots of <w>panacea</w>.

senses.sense_definition: The goddess and personification of healing and remedies in Greek mythology.

examples.text: Statues of <w>Panacea</w> were often placed in ancient healing temples alongside her father Asclepius.
In the myth, <w>Panacea</w> used magical potions to restore health to the sick.
